name: ancymidol
Reason: 1,2-propanediol base, with melting point around 50 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in ancymidol will affect its melting point: (1) Two phenyl groups, which could each add approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (2) The tertiary butyl group (C(C)C) is a bulky group which could add about +10 due to steric hindrance and increasing the molecular volume; (3) The piperidine ring (N1CCCC1) and 1-ethyl-4-methylenepiperidine moiety may both add roughly +20 each due to adding more rigid ring structures and making the molecule more compact; (4) The methoxy group (Oc1ccccc1Oc1) can raise the melting point by about +5 due to additional molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
